condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Financing Agreement(Mining Governance and Growth Support Project) | Description :(a) The Recipient shall, notlater than 18 months after the Effective Date, carry out a strategic environmental and social assessment of the Recipient's miningsector under terms of reference sat | Due Date :24-Feb-2014

title.narrative: Number of students newly enrolled in mining-related tertiary education programs in Malawi (with breakdown by gender)
Number of public service personnel trained in sector-relevant fields (with breakdown by gender)
Sustainability - Percentage of mining operations subjected to environmental certification
Efficiency - Days taken to issue mineral rights
Multi-stakeholder forum on mining sector established with civil society participation

baseline.value: Ad hoc and reactive arrangements for stakeholder dialogue

target.value: Regular meetings of multi-stakeholder forum taking place

actual.value: The EITI Multi Stakeholder Group (MSG) has made progress towards EITI validation. The group is on track to release the first reportby April 2017.The MSG continues to meet on a quarterly basis.

title.narrative: Health, safety, environmental and social management policies and monitoring systems completed

baseline.value: Gaps exist in policy framework and monitoring systems are in need of significant strengthening

target.value: Policy framework complete and monitoring system in place

actual.value: The Policy Framework for Safety, environmental and social management has is in place.

title.narrative: Modern computerized mining cadastre in use

baseline.value: Minerals licensing conducted using slow and paper based system

actual.value: A contract has been awarded and the Consultants have already started implementation. Some of Malawi’s mining licenses are alreadyvisible online. Building refurbishment works have commenced.

baseline.value: Mining Policy in place but new mining act and regulations, amended mineral taxation legislation and model mining agreement stillunder development

target.value: New mining regulations submitted to relevant authorities

actual.value: The Mines and Minerals Act has been reviewed and the Bill and associated regulations have been finalized. The activity suffered anumber of delays and is now expected to be tabled in the February 2016 seating of Parliament.

title.narrative: Mineral tax administration and revenue management developed

baseline.value: No specialized arrangements for minerals tax administration and revenue management

target.value: Policies to address revenue volatility and savings introduced

actual.value: The tabling in parliament has delayed. The next session of parliament now is February 2017. The Ministry of Justice isincorporation EITI issues.

baseline.value: Royalty and tax terms open to negotiation and selective concession

target.value: Standardized royalty and tax laws and regulations drafted

actual.value: Standardized royalty and tax laws and regulations drafted.Target Achieved.

title.narrative: Transparency - Annual public reporting of mineral sector tax revenues
Geo-data management center providing online access

baseline.value: Only old and insufficient geo-data available

target.value: Geo-data management centre in operation and accessible on-line

actual.value: Up-to-date geo-data is in place. and can be accessed manually at GSD. A Firm is delivering the design and installation of theon-line geological database that will be housed at the refurbished Geodata Center.
